tweet: Happy Pride San Francisco! Enjoy this weekend’s celebration of the progress we’ve made in the 50 years since Stonewall. We still have work to do. But this community’s resilience and grit is proof that we won’t stop working until all Americans have full equality.
War with Iran is in nobody’s interest. It’s time for the administration to take a different tact by dropping its hostile rhetoric and engage in immediate diplomacy. pic.twitter.com/NnSMVgSZUI

The administration’s bellicose approach toward Iran has failed to produce any tangible results. Iran’s response, by shooting down an American drone, attacking oil tankers & getting closer to violating its obligations under the nuclear agreement, is also unproductive & dangerous.
It’s disappointing that while a majority of the senators present cast their votes to reclaim our constitutional prerogative and block an unauthorized attack on Iran, the amendment failed today.

Equality isn’t a partisan issue, it’s a defining characteristic for our country. It’s something that should be above party politics. That’s why I’ll keep advocating for Senate action to reverse these hateful policies and move the fight for equality forward, not backward.

From allowing health care workers and adoption agencies to openly discriminate against LGBT+ Americans, to arguing that employers should be able to fire employees based on sexual orientation or gender identity, this administration has consistently attacked the LGBT+ community.

#Pride may be coming to a close this weekend, but we have many challenges ahead in the fight for LGBT+ rights. Recent actions taken by this administration are added cause for concern. https://www.feinstein.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/press-releases?id=36FF9C0E-0FAC-484F-A822-C59B900D0070 …

Proud to join my colleagues on a Senate resolution commemorating the Stonewall Uprising on the 50th anniversary. As we celebrate #Pride, let’s remember the movement that started over two nights in 1969 and the work we still have ahead of us. #Stonewall50 pic.twitter.com/fBzqsbbJEy

Fifty years ago, Marsha P. Johnson, Sylvia Rivera and the rioters at the Stonewall Inn rose up and ignited a movement for LGBT+ equality. As this hard-fought progress comes under attack, we must remember their courage and continue the fight for full equality. #Stonewall50

Many parents have had success treating their children with CBD oil, particularly for epilepsy, but current regulations make medical marijuana research difficult. Our bill streamlines the research process and paves the way for marijuana-derived medications that are FDA-approved. pic.twitter.com/T3ZZb5jAVV

I hope the administration will abandon this partisan endeavor and instead work with Congress and the states to maximize responses to the census to ensure a fair and accurate count of everyone living in the United States. pic.twitter.com/xv8WYP5ksb

Such a result would affect everything from voting representation to federal funding for infrastructure, schools and safety-net programs, which would be particularly harmful to diverse states like California.

I’m concerned what that will mean for future rulings. The Constitution calls for an accurate count of ALL individuals living in the U.S.. A Census Bureau report found that adding the citizenship question could result in an up to 8 % undercount.

I’m pleased the Supreme Court rejected the administration’s rationale for adding a citizenship question. However, the court’s conservative majority overlooked clear evidence that adding it would discourage census participation in immigrant communities and communities of color.
The Supreme Court decision on gerrymandering means every congressional district may be subject to the political manipulation of elected officials. Gerrymandering will get worse, not better.

Despite advances in preventing, detecting and treating HIV, stigma remains an obstacle. The CDC estimates that 1 in 7 people living with HIV don’t know they have it. This National #HIVTestingDay, find a free testing site near you and #KnowYourStatus https://www.greaterthan.org/free-hiv-testing-walgreens-2019/ …

BREAKING: Governor Newsom has signed a bill into law that allows the suspension of racetrack licenses to keep horses safe. This is welcome news and a step in the right direction after a season with so many fatalities. I applaud State Senator @BillDoddCA for introducing this bill.

We’re calling for an inspector general investigation into reports that the administration is suppressing scientific data about the effects of climate change. Deeply concerning article on horse deaths at Santa Anita Park. 30 horses have died since December at this track, and fatalities on U.S. racetracks are much higher than in other countries. We can’t continue to let this happen. https://twitter.com/NYTNational/status/1143932452773203968 …

That’s why we must pass the Personal Care Products Safety Act, our bill to modernize regulations for the $60 billion personal care products industry. From shampoo to deodorant, baby lotion to makeup, we use these products daily. Americans have the right to know if they’re safe. pic.twitter.com/LH6tKkSICV

Today marks 81 years since the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetics Act was signed into law. That was the last time safety rules for personal care products were updated and the law hasn’t kept up with new products over the past eight decades, and that puts everyone’s health at risk.

Sadly, opponents of commonsense gun safety laws continue to block lifesaving proposals. They offer thoughts and prayers, then return to business as usual. Read my op-ed with @ChrisMurphyCT about steps we can take to start saving lives. http://mag.time.com/JSS2VnV

As #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessMonth comes to a close, one thing is clear: current laws are insufficient. The proof is in the ever-increasing death toll. An overwhelming majority of Americans agrees that we need stricter gun regulations.

We’ve introduced two bills that would end family separation: the Keep Families Together Act and the Protecting Families and Improving Immigration Procedures Act. Both deserve a vote in the full Senate. Keeping children with their parents shouldn’t be a partisan issue.

Given the positions he has taken in litigation and the inflammatory comments he has made in his personal capacity, I am concerned Mr. Kacsmaryk will not bring the temperament needed to demonstrate respect for ALL litigants. I cannot support his nomination.

Additionally, Mr. Kacsmaryk has argued that being transgender is a “delusion.” He also signed onto a letter claiming that transgender people are suffering from a “psychological condition in need of care,” and are “not a category of persons in need of special legal protection.”

Mr. Kacsmaryk urged a court to deny that the Fourteenth Amendment extended to the right of same-sex couples to marry. He argued that a nationwide right to marriage equality would violate the free speech rights of those who oppose same-sex marriage on religious grounds.

Kacsmaryk claimed that the Obama Administration — which refused to defend DOMA — had “effectively collaborated with the adversary.”  Mr. Kacsmaryk made clear that he believes those fighting for the right of LGBT Americans — including the right to marry — are adversaries.

Mr. Kacsmaryk’s long record of opposing civil rights protections for LGBT Americans should disqualify him from service on the bench.  They demonstrate that he puts his personal opinion above Supreme Court precedent.

THREAD: Today we voted on a nominee—Matthew Kacsmaryk—whose career has been defined by opposition to the rights of LGBT Americans.  He has argued against marriage equality, offensively described the transgender community and defended discrimination against same-sex couples.

It’s been more than 80 years since consumer safety laws for personal care products were last updated. From makeup to shampoo, these are products that men, women and children put on their skin daily, and we have right to know whether they’re safe.  https://www.feinstein.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/press-releases?id=268B6E87-A20D-44DA-A959-0A3B00E8E371 …

News that makeup containing asbestos was sold by Claire’s and Beauty Plus highlights why we need the Personal Care Products Safety Act. The FDA still lacks the authority to recall personal care products that threaten public health, and our bill fixes that.

Wishing the U.S. women’s national soccer team the best of luck today as they start the World Cup. I’m proud of this team for what they’ve achieved both on and off the field. I stand with these reigning world champions and their demand for equal pay with the men’s national team.

It is unacceptable that in this day and age women who raise children make just 69 cents for every dollar that white fathers make on average. This gap increases for mothers of color. It’s long past time for the Senate to pass the #PayCheckFairnessAct. #MomsEqualPayDay

Our bill helps protect vulnerable immigrant children while providing resources for the immigration system to work more efficiently. It provides more judges, protects the Flores agreement, provides attorneys for unaccompanied children and gives judges flexibility in the courtroom.

Laws restricting reproductive health care force women to take extraordinary measures and risk their health. These are difficult and personal decisions that should be left up to women, not politicians. #StopTheBans

Politicians must not interfere in the most personal and difficult medical decisions women face. The recent passage of restrictive, cruel and unconstitutional laws cannot stand. Reproductive care is health care. #StopTheBans

New laws in Alabama, Missouri, Georgia, Ohio and Louisiana banning abortion are blatantly unconstitutional and the latest in Republicans’ efforts to overturn Roe v. Wade. These ongoing attacks on women’s health must stop. I remember what it was like before Roe. We can’t go back.
Heartbroken at yet another senseless mass shooting, this time in Virginia Beach. My heart is with the victim’s’ families. It’s time for commonsense gun safety laws. It’s time to save lives.
